item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

I like the colors a little more on that one, but you might want to expose it less and then play with color mapping to bring up the brightness without blowing out 1/3 of the image.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:26, topic:250837”]Dear god, that’s atrocious. The settings of the render at least.

Up the hemispheric sub-d’s by a lot. Maybe double. And set it to -3/-1. Maybe even -3/0.

Wood texture needs to be scaled down. Make the room seem miniature. Give that ring base some sort of texture.

I’m really iffy about the chair though.[/quote]
The render settings, i dont know what happened but it just started looking like paper.

The chair was supposed to get light on it and look plastic, but its in a bad spot…[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 21, 2008, 12:03:27 am[/size][hr]

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Dear god, that’s atrocious. The settings of the render at least.

Up the hemispheric sub-d’s by a lot. Maybe double. And set it to -3/-1. Maybe even -3/0.

Wood texture needs to be scaled down. Make the room seem miniature. Give that ring base some sort of texture.

I’m really iffy about the chair though.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

It’s pretty much a white environment. In that case, no lights just a giant really luminant white background. Or an area light in the window.

Bedrooms aren’t small and simple though. Unless you’re going for brand new bedroom haven’t really moved in.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

Im going to re-do this entire thing, i liked the bedroom at first but i dont like it so much, im going to do it like a real bedroom, small and simple. And ill also try to make some models out of things in my house and catalogs or google.

Also, i remember you told me at one point, but i completely forgot. But how do you get that glow outside like that?

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

A little. But it doesn’t scale it in every axis perfectly. It does maybe two mm in the x or z, whatever that way is in this scene.

Simple answer, just scale it down. Or scale the entire scene correctly.

Look at this bedroom render.

I can already pick out like three things wrong with it. But it works more than your image. Study it.

Work was put into it. It has nice textures (though two of the problems are with textures, they’re better than normal). Time was put into modeling a nice bed, and a table. The rooms design just works in general. It’s a much more pleasing image.

Your’s I can recreate in minutes. You put a box under the bed and what can be done with a few small cylinders for the frame, same with the table. The mattress looks alright, but on close up you see artifacts. Then you put a cloth on it.

The windows look pretty nice, but don’t fit the scale of the room. I want the curtains to be less transparent though, or look like it.

The little chandelier thing you have hanging is also basic. Almost no modeling or creative thinking was done here. The roof seems like it was a last minute thing to stand out or spice something up.

Maybe start modeling real things. Like finding or creating designs of tables and beds etc etc and then modeling those. Instead of throwing in representational things for them.

Read full topic

item.title: [C4D] Bedroom
item.dc:creator: @Frell Frell
item.description:
@Frell wrote:

[quote=“SomethingToHide, post:15, topic:250837”][quote author=Frell link=topic=330914.msg2588466#msg2588466 date=1229636282]

Might just be me, but the either the bed is really small, or the windows are massive…

Other than that, looks good.

Like the plate on the table next to the TV is about half the side of the bed…

No i have the camera in a way that makes it do that. It views more of the room so it stretches it, and since those are closer it makes them biggest.
[/quote]

Trust me. That is not the reason. I’m a photographer and you’re working with the same kinda stuff, just virtual.

Nothing gets stretched like that. It’s too big.[/quote]
I created the plate over the bed to scale, the plate is about 1/4 of the bed which isnt right either. But the view does change how big it is a little bit.

Read full topic

Its not so bad.
